intro: Aristotelia megalosperma, commonly known as the giant kōwhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Elaeocarpaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces distinctive, elongated fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is typically found in coastal and lowland areas, growing as a shrub or small tree. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
